lexUnit.name: carelessness.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: carelessness is a derivative of careless

sentence.text: Anthony would probably move on sooner or later ; his bosses , two Anglo-Italian academics , had already warned him about the carelessness of his work .
In 1940 , the school was badly damaged by fire -- not by enemy action , but ( it seems ) by the carelessness of fire-watchers installed at night to forestall such action .
The Academy lists are full of spelling mistakes ; whether they reflect the carelessness of the artists or later wrong transcriptions one can not tell .
I FELT compelled to reply immediately to your story about the four children robbed of a father this Christmas by the carelessness of an alleged drunken driver .
Printers began the errata business very early , for a 1478 edition of Juvenal lists mistakes on two leaves , the printer attributing them to the carelessness of a workman .
Often employers acknowledged no liability , blaming the carelessness of the worker , who might if the injuries were serious be thereafter unemployable .
How wide the sphere of the duty of care in negligence is to be laid depends ultimately on the court 's assessment of the demands of society for protection from the carelessness of others .
to the crass carelessness of passers by .
Central to this is , of course , the realisation that most cases of food poisoning result from carelessness by food handlers -- hence the emphasis now on training .
The seventeenth-century poet Robert Herrick thought that a little carelessness in appearance was actually very exciting :
The way to convince this Matron of my mother 's extreme need of a hospital bed is not through any show of carelessness on my part .

It was therefore important and exciting to notice that there was a light in a ground-floor window of his house and that , by a fortunate piece of carelessness on somebody 's part , the curtains had not been drawn .
Unfortunately , because of mankind 's carelessness with PCBs in the past , they are already ubiquitous .
Whatever Romania 's military aspirations , Bucharest certainly has a record of carelessness with nuclear materials .
People lose money from pockets , purses , wallets and handbags in such large amounts that their carelessness with coins actually has an effect on the profitability of the Royal Mint .
You feel like a climber who unties the rope when he finds it irksome and , because of your carelessness , someone behind slips and falls to his death . "
On those rare occasions when it slipped out accidentally , her rage was a clear indication of how deeply his carelessness pained her .
It only takes a moment 's carelessness to make a present of your valuables to the thief .
He sat , petrified , the implications of his carelessness seeping into his brain .
Naturally , the carrier can not be held responsible for loss or damage which results from the trader 's carelessness or negligence .
The vast bulk of these were not caused by employees ' carelessness or stupidity but by the conditions under which they are obliged to work .

Dameta had taken one look at her heated countenance when she 'd emerged from the pleasance , and had ordered her to bed , muttering about fevers and the carelessness of wandering about in gardens without a mantle .
Vaisey J went on to say that the employers had shown " the utmost carelessness in allowing this defendant to get knowledge of what they knew was a very valuable secret …
Carelessness could be dangerous .
No dishonesty was suspected , only carelessness .
Farmers , it was claimed , were basically honest people but their book keeping was not all that it should be which could result in some omissions due to carelessness .
